Overview

The USC Noise reduction sample is a command line based application. It supports two components: Noise Reduction and Voice Acticity Detection.

The Noise reduction sample’s component processes input PCM file narrow band 16bit 8000 Hz and creates output PCM file narrow band 16bit 8000 Hz.

The VAD detection sample’s component processes input PCM file narrow band 16bit 8000 Hz or wide band 16bit 16000 Hz and creates output PCM file narrow band 16bit 8000 Hz or wide band 16bit 16000 Hz respectively. Various VAD algorithms are supported including G.723, G.729, AMRWB and IPP VAD algorithm which originally was released in IPP speech-recognition audio-processing VAD sample.

Additional information on this software as well as other Intel ® Software Development Products is available at http://developer.intel.com/software/products/ .

How to Build Source Code

Build target by Microsoft Visual Studio

  • Set system environment variable IPPROOT
  • Open solution/project file in related Visual Studio
  • Select configuration/platform you need
  • Build all projects in Visual Studio

Running the Sample

For information on building the sample, see the readme file in the ipp_samples\speech-codecs directory.

In order to run the executable created by this sample, the Intel®IPP DLLs must be on the system's path. DLLs are located in the bin subdirectory of the root directory of the Intel®IPP installation (IPPROOT). This can be done by setting the PATH environment variable manually or invoking the batch file: "%IPPROOT%\tools\env\ippenv.bat" from the Intel®IPP installation.

  • To run the USC noise reduction sample type: 

usc_nr.exe [options] <inPCMFile> <outPCMFile> 

The option list: 

-alg IPP_NR_EPHM|IPP_NR_EC|IPP_VADG723|IPP_VADG729_FP|IPP_VADG729|IPP_VAD|IPP_VADAMRWBE - filter algorithm name.

IPP_NR_EPHM - Ehprame-Malah based Noise Reduction algorithm.

IPP_NR_EC - IPP based Noise Reduction algorithm.

IPP_NR_RTA_FP - Microsoft RT Audio Noise-Suppressor algorithm.

IPP_VADG723 - ITU G.723.1 VAD algorithm.

IPP_VADG729_FP - ITU G.729 floating-point VAD algorithm.

IPP_VADG729 - ITU G.729 VAD algorithm.

IPP_VAD - IPP based VAD algorithm.

IPP_VADAMRWBE - 3GPP AMR WB  VAD algorithm.

-f<freq>              Sample frequency in Hertz. 16000 for IPP_VAD algorithm, 8000 for others.

-n                        output additional information  (optional).

-list                     Enumerate linked USC signal filter algorithms and exit  (optional).

  -o <logFile>      write to <logFile> file log information (optional).
<inPCMFile> - input audio PCM file 8000 Hz (IPP_NR_EPHM, IPP_NR_EC, IPP_NR_RTA_FP, IPP_VADG723, IPP_VADG729_FP, IPP_VADG729 algorithms) or 16000 Hz (IPP_VAD and IPP_VADAMRWBE algorithms) or 22050 Hz and 32000 Hz ( IPP_NR_RTA_FP).

<outPCMFile> - output audio PCM file 8000 Hz (IPP_NR_EPHM, IPP_NR_EC, IPP_NR_RTA_FP, IPP_VADG723, IPP_VADG729_FP, IPP_VADG729 algorithms) or 16000 Hz ( IPP_NR_RTA_FP, IPP_VAD and IPP_VADAMRWBE algorithms) or 22050 and 32000 Hz ( IPP_NR_RTA_FP).
